Facebook is seeking maverick software engineers to help connect as many of the 4 billion unconnected via wireless / mobile access as possible.  This is not going to happen via the "traditional" telecom paradigm, and we are specifically looking for talented software generalists willing to apply their superpowers to upgrading legacy telecom infrastructure, enabling Carriers to aggressively and profitably expand into rural and other underserved areas.  

TIP will explore new approaches and technologies across three initial focus areas: access, backhaul, and core and management. The project groups within these areas will leverage the unique engineering and operational expertise of each member, and they will focus on developing new technologies and exploring new approaches to deployment in both developed and emerging markets. In the near term, TIP's work will focus primarily on disaggregating the hardware and software layers in the traditional network stack and recombining those elements in ways that enable significant efficiency gains in urban and rural deployments. TIP will also collaborate on the acceleration of technologies like 5G and the development of new technologies that will pave the way for better connectivity and richer services.

Telecom software experience is nice, but definitely not required.  If you're an extraordinarily gifted software engineer and believe that everyone in the world should be able to make a phone call, then we'd like to talk to you.

This position is full-time and located in our Menlo Park office.
589: Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.

We want Facebook to be the most loved company in the technology industry.  And part of building our brand is making sure people get the most out of their Facebook experience.  We're looking for an entrepreneurial content marketer to join our nimble team.  You'll be responsible for understanding the target consumer and setting the strategy for communications people see from Facebook when they open the app.  If you've got the creative and analytical chops, if you're a self-starter with a passion for product and consumers, and if you have a history of driving results, then you just might be the person for the job.
This is a full-time position based at our headquarters in Menlo Park.
590: Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.

Messenger is the place to instantly reach the people in your life.  Messenger is used by 800M people every month and is one of the top five most-used apps in almost every country across the globe.  This tremendous reach is a marketer's dream, and we have been building products for businesses to more effectively talk to people on Messenger since launching businesses on Messenger last year.

We're looking for someone to join our small (and growing) marketing team to communicate with consumers, developers, and businesses about the value of interacting with one another on Messenger.  We've built products ranging from deep integrations (http://newsroom.fb.com/news/2015/12/introducing-transportation-on-messenger/)  with consumer apps to tools  (https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2015/03/25/introducing-messenger-platform-and-businesses-on-messenger/)that make it easier for businesses to scale their conversations with potential customers.  The Consumer Product Marketing Messenger  team is responsible for all elements of marketing this work to consumers globally. This includes crafting the product narratives, informing product strategy with insights, marketing campaigns, go-to-market planning and execution. If you have a history of leading projects and teams, if youâve got strong instincts for good products, creative and analytical chops, if you're a self-starter with a passion for technology thatâs integral to consumerâs lives, and if you have a passion for bridging two audiences on a single platform, then you just might be the person for the job. The successful candidate must be an experienced marketer, data-driven, and a self-starter. Experience in marketing to businesses and understanding business needs a plus.

Sourcing activities will include, but not be limited to, identification of product and service availability and options, developing and leading negotiation and sourcing strategies, partnering with Facebook project, engineering and technology teams to develop a business and technology roadmap in support of Facebookâs infrastructure goals and objectives, and driving strategic sourcing decisions on a global basis.

Working closely with the Engineering Teams, the Sourcing Manager will lead the commercial engagement, prototype sourcing and development in support of new product development and introduction, and deployment of selected solutions and technologies.  Will own supplier management with particular emphasis in the areas of sourcing for advanced technologies, contracts, negotiation, joint development models, IP and licensing, and the development of global commodity and supply chain strategies that enable Facebook to meet time-to-development/time-to-production goals, while managing the total landed cost.
